remarks: Bound a finite sum based on the harmonic series, where the "strong" bound ` C ` only applies asymptotically, and there is a "weak" bound ` R ` for the remaining values.  (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 18-May-2016.)
statement:
fsumharmonic.a $e |- ( ph -> A e. RR+ ) $.
fsumharmonic.t $e |- ( ph -> ( T e. RR /\ 1 <_ T ) ) $.
fsumharmonic.r $e |- ( ph -> ( R e. RR /\ 0 <_ R ) ) $.
fsumharmonic.b $e |- ( ( ph /\ n e. ( 1 ... ( |_ ` A ) ) ) -> B e. CC ) $.
fsumharmonic.c $e |- ( ( ph /\ n e. ( 1 ... ( |_ ` A ) ) ) -> C e. RR ) $.
fsumharmonic.0 $e |- ( ( ph /\ n e. ( 1 ... ( |_ ` A ) ) ) -> 0 <_ C ) $.
fsumharmonic.1 $e |- ( ( ( ph /\ n e. ( 1 ... ( |_ ` A ) ) ) /\ T <_ ( A / n ) ) -> ( abs ` B ) <_ ( C x. n ) ) $.
fsumharmonic.2 $e |- ( ( ( ph /\ n e. ( 1 ... ( |_ ` A ) ) ) /\ ( A / n ) < T ) -> ( abs ` B ) <_ R ) $.
fsumharmonic $p |- ( ph -> ( abs ` sum_ n e. ( 1 ... ( |_ ` A ) ) ( B / n ) ) <_ ( sum_ n e. ( 1 ... ( |_ ` A ) ) C + ( R x. ( ( log ` T ) + 1 ) ) ) ) $.
$d A n $.
$d R n $.
$d T n $.
$d n ph $.
